value.text: Change of direction Numerical families (Part II)

text:
Prerequisites

In this text, we reinfornce knowledge about the numerical systems. For more details, we recommend starting with:

• Drawing to count: show how we change from our fingers to geometric pictures.
  • Numerical families: Illustrating the relationship between our ancestors and numbers.

Rules

The goal of the game is to complete numerical sequences while respecting the maximum and minimum limits of the selected numerical system. Before starting, choose the numerical system you want to use. In each step, you will be presented with two numbers and will need to determine the third using the controls. For each correct answer, you will be introduced to an indigenous tool. Once you complete a level, click "Next" (), to continue. After finishing all 10 levels, you will earn a medal ().
The Hindu-Arabic and Mesoamerican numerical systems are presented within a table. However, when playing with the Yupana system, the comparisons are made between different tables.

Nós utilizamos a Yupana através do método "Yupana Inka Tawa Pukllay", desenvolvido e publicado por Dhavit Prem (Prem, Dhavit) da Associação Yupanki (Prem, Dhavit, ).
A aplicação dos números mesoamericanos é baseada no trabalho de Orlando Josué Casares Contreras, José M. Gamboa Cetina e Venus Sarahí Estrella Cabrera (Casares Contreras, Orlando & Cetina, José & Cabrera, Venus Sarahí, , (ResearchGate) ; Casares Contreras, Orlando & Cetina, José & Cabrera, Venus Sarahí, , (Revista)). Além disso, incorporamos as contribuições de Francico Barriga Puente (Puente, Francico Barriga, ).
Por fim, empregamos diversos métodos de contagem inspirados pelo trabalho de Francisco A. González Redondo et al. (González Redondo, Francisco A., et al., ).
